value.title: Describe Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the Power BI Desktop model structure, star schema design basics, analytics queries, and report visual configuration. This module provides a strong foundation on which you can learn to optimize model designs and add model calculations.

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Create a Power BI Dashboard in 10 Minutes!
value.excerpt: Enjoy my free full course on Udemy https://www.udemy.com/share/102Qqu/ Learn how to quickly create your first dashboard using Microsoft Power BI fast. This tutorial will teach you how to load, transform and visualize data with ease.  Contact me on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland

value.title: Price Prediction with Python and Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to create a machine learning price prediction using Python machine learning linear regression model and a dataset of 54,000 diamonds. This will be ported over to Power BI for a deeper level of interaction.  You can find the files and dataset here: https://github.com/Gaelim/Diamond-Price-Prediction

value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays! #: 75: SAMEPERIODLASTYEAR
value.excerpt: In today's video we will go through the DAX function called SAMEPERIODLASTYEAR.  This little function is great for analyzing as the function itself says, the same period last year.  If you have seasonal business and you want to analyze what happended the same period the previous year, it will do it flowless.

value.title: Differences between Power BI Apps and Workspaces
value.excerpt: In today's video I am going to show you the difference between Power Bi Apps and workspaces and what do I use them for. I also explain why I think that workspaces are too messy for the business user or data consumer.  Links to resources mentioned in the video: The new App Navigation video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Bo0HHUcuas
